head.title: Don't Start New York on School Vouchers Path

hedline.hl1: Don't Start New York on School Vouchers Path

abstract.p: Letter from Bishop Richard F Grein says John Cardinal O'Connor's offer to take 1,000 New York City schoolchildren into Catholic Archdicese's school system might pit public against parochial system (S)

block.p: I believe the offer by John Cardinal O'Connor to take 1,000 poorly performing New York City schoolchildren into the Catholic Archdiocese's school system (news articles, Sept. 9-12) is well intentioned and of good will, but it bears not a small amount of competition -- pitting the public against the parochial system.
I am opposed to any such competition because I believe it would be a prelude to a strong move for a voucher system. Such a system would be the end of our public school system as we have known it.

I am opposed to any such competition because I believe it would be a prelude to a strong move for a voucher system. Such a system would be the end of our public school system as we have known it.

Fifty years ago, many Roman Catholic schools, if not most, were found wanting when compared with public schools. Now that situation is reversed, largely because the public schools have deteriorated. Under a voucher system, public schools will only deteroriate further. We all know a good public school system is essential to this city and to this country.
The Diocese of New York of the Episcopal Church
